title: 107_hr3340
content: SECTION 1. THRIFT SAVINGS PLAN CATCH-UP CONTRIBUTIONS. The amendment allows eligible participants to make additional contributions to the Thrift Savings Fund as permitted by section 414(v) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment allows eligible participants to make additional contributions to the Thrift Savings Fund as permitted by section 414(v) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 and regulations of the Executive Director. SEC. 2. Reauthorization of Merit System Protection Board and Office of Special Counsel, amending dates for both entities to 2003-2007. Effective date is October 1, 2002. SEC. 3. Disclosure of violations of law and return of documents. SEC. 3. Amends Section 1213(g) of title 5, United States Code regarding disclosure of violations of law. If the Special Counsel does not transmit information to the agency, they must inform the individual of reasons and other offices for disclosures. SEC. 4. Continuation of health benefits coverage for individuals enrolled in a plan administered by the Overseas Private Investment Corporation. Enrollment in Chapter 89 Plan under title 5, United States Code is extended to individuals previously enrolled in a health benefits plan administered by the Overseas Private Investment Corporation. Those covered by the Corporation's plan may now enroll in approved health benefits plans under section 8903 or 8903a for themselves or their families. Individuals previously covered by the Overseas Private Investment Corporation's health benefits plan can now enroll in approved health benefits plans under section 8903 or 8903a of title 5, United States Code for themselves or their unmarried dependent children. Enrollment eligibility date for unmarried dependent children under the Overseas Private Investment Corporation's health benefits plan allows continued coverage under section 8905a of title 5, United States Code. They can also enroll in approved health benefits plans under section 8903 or 8903a for continued coverage. The Overseas Private Investment Corporation will transfer funds to the Employees Health Benefits Fund to reimburse for providing benefits, with amounts determined by the Director of the Office of Personnel Management. The transferred amounts will be held in the Fund and used in addition to other available funds. The Office of Personnel Management will administer the section, including notice and open enrollment for individuals. The enrollment eligibility date is the last day for coverage under a health benefits plan administered by the Overseas Private Investment Corporation. The Office of Personnel Management, in consultation with the Overseas Private Investment Corporation, will determine this date. Regulations may be prescribed to implement this section. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
